de.sengerts.tictactoe.model.board

Class Territory

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.sengerts.tictactoe.model.board.Territory

  • public class Territory
extends java.lang.Object
    Class representing the territory of a tic tac toe game. A territory is a rectangular area, composed of multiple tiles, with equal width and height specified by a given positive size.
    Author:
    Tobias Senger

    • Constructor Summary

    • Constructor Detail

      • Territory

        public Territory(GameLogic ticTacToeGame)
        Another constructor for class Territory. Creates a new object of type Territory with a given not null tic tac toe game that this territory is associated with containing the size for this territory.
        Parameters:
        ticTacToeGame - the tic tac toe game this territory is associated with
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if given size is not positive

    • Method Detail

      • isEveryTileMarked

        public boolean isEveryTileMarked()
        Gets if all tiles in this territory are marked. Gets if all tiles in this territory are marked by filtering the stream of the list of tiles by not marked tiles and checking if the count of the filtered stream is zero.
        Returns:
        true if all tiles in this territory are marked, otherwise false

      • isRowCompletelyMarkedByOnePlayer

        public boolean isRowCompletelyMarkedByOnePlayer(int row)
        Gets if a given row in this territory is completely marked by one player. Gets if a given row in this territory is completely marked by one player by checking if all elements of the stream of all tiles in this territory filtered by the given row are marked and all tiles have been marked by the same player. isStreamOfTilesCompletelyMarkedByOnePlayer(Supplier<Stream<Tile>>)
        Parameters:
        row - the row of the tiles to check
        Returns:
        true if all tiles in the row are marked by the same player, otherwise false

      • isColumnCompletelyMarkedByOnePlayer

        public boolean isColumnCompletelyMarkedByOnePlayer(int column)
        Gets if a given column in this territory is completely marked by one player. Gets if a given column in this territory is completely marked by one player by checking if all elements of the stream of all tiles in this territory filtered by the given column are marked and all tiles have been marked by the same player. isStreamOfTilesCompletelyMarkedByOnePlayer(Supplier<Stream<Tile>>)
        Parameters:
        column - the column of the tiles to check
        Returns:
        true if all tiles in the column are marked by the same player, otherwise false

      • isLeftDiagCompletelyMarkedByOnePlayer

        public boolean isLeftDiagCompletelyMarkedByOnePlayer()
        Gets if the left diag in this territory is completely marked by one player. Gets if the left diag in this territory is completely marked by one player by checking if all tiles in the left diag of this territory are marked and marked by the same player.
        Returns:
        true if left diag is completely marked by the same player, otherwise false

      • isRightDiagCompletelyMarkedByOnePlayer

        public boolean isRightDiagCompletelyMarkedByOnePlayer()
        Gets if the right diag in this territory is completely marked by one player. Gets if the right diag in this territory is completely marked by one player by checking if all tiles in the right diag of this territory are marked and marked by the same player.
        Returns:
        true if right diag is completely marked by the same player, otherwise false

      • getLeftDiagTilesStreamSupplier

        public java.util.function.Supplier<java.util.stream.Stream<Tile>> getLeftDiagTilesStreamSupplier()
        Gets a supplier of the stream of all tiles in the left diag in this territory. Gets a supplier of the stream of all tiles in the left diag in this territory by filtering the stream of all tiles in this territory by the ones that have the same id for row and column (e.g. (0, 0) or (1, 1)).
        Returns:
        a supplier of the stream of all tiles in the left diag

      • getRightDiagTilesStreamSupplier

        public java.util.function.Supplier<java.util.stream.Stream<Tile>> getRightDiagTilesStreamSupplier()
        Gets a supplier of the stream of all tiles in the right diag in this territory. Gets a supplier of the stream of all tiles in the right diag in this territory by filtering the stream of all tiles in this territory by the ones for whom the column id equals the columns count of this territory minus the row id of the tile. (e.g. (0, 2) or (1, 1)).
        Returns:
        a supplier of the stream of all tiles in the right diag

      • getRowTilesStreamSupplier

        public java.util.function.Supplier<java.util.stream.Stream<Tile>> getRowTilesStreamSupplier(int row)
        Gets a supplier for the stream of all tiles in a given row in this territory. Gets a supplier for the stream of all tiles in a given row in this territory by filtering the stream of all tiles in this territory by the ones in the given row.
        Parameters:
        row - the row of the searched tiles
        Returns:
        a supplier for the stream of all tiles in the given row

      • getColumnTilesStreamSupplier

        public java.util.function.Supplier<java.util.stream.Stream<Tile>> getColumnTilesStreamSupplier(int column)
        Gets a supplier for a stream of all tiles in a given column in this territory. Gets a supplier for a stream of all tiles in a given column in this territory by filtering the stream of all tiles in this territory by the ones in the given column.
        Parameters:
        column - the column of the searched tiles
        Returns:
        a supplier for the stream of all tiles in the given column

      • getTile

        public Tile getTile(Location location)
        Gets a tile at a location. Gets a tile at a given location by caculating the tile index by given location (getTileIndexByLocation(Location location)) and returning the element with this index from the list in the instance variable tiles.
        Parameters:
        location - the location to get the tile from
        Returns:
        the tile at the given location
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if given location is null or not inside the territory

      • getTilesAmount

        public int getTilesAmount()
        Gets the number of tiles in this territory. Gets the number of tiles in this territory by getting the size of the list of tiles in the instance variable tiles.
        Returns:
        size of the list of tiles of this territory

      • isLocationInTerritory

        public boolean isLocationInTerritory(Location location)
        Gets if a location is inside the territory. Gets if a location is inside the territory by checking if its row and column are both less than the size of the territory whereas the row and column of the location are at least zero by default.
        Parameters:
        location - the location to check
        Returns:
        true if the location is inside, otherwise returns false

      • getTileIndexByLocation

        public int getTileIndexByLocation(Location location)
        Gets the index of a tile by its location. Gets the index of a tile for the list in the instance tiles by multiplying the locations row with the width of the territory (column count) as an offset and adding the column of the location.
        Parameters:
        location - the location to get the tiles list index of
        Returns:
        the index for a tile at a given location

      • getTicTacToeGame

        public GameLogic getTicTacToeGame()
        Gets this players tic tac toe game. Returns the tic tac toe game object that this territory is associated with.
        Returns:
        this territorys tic tac toe game

      • getTiles

        public java.util.List<Tile> getTiles()
        Gets the tiles. Returns all tiles of this territory object representing all fields of this square tic tac toe territory.
        Returns:
        the list of tiles for this territory

      • getSize

        public Dimension getSize()
        Gets the size. Returns the size of this territory object representing the rows and columns counts of this square territory.
        Returns:
        the size of this territory
